--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "John Arrowwood" <jarrowwx@h...> wrote:
> Since the documentation asked for those considering an experiment
for NEAT 
> to let the author know, I figured I'd write in...
> 
> I've read several papers that discussed the use of neural networks
for image 
> enlargement.  With each, I could see some potential areas of
improvement 
> over the original research.  One of which is network topology, for
which 
> NEAT is a good match.
> 
> My plan is to do some detailed statistical analysis of natural
photos and to 
> cull out some good, representative training data to use in
conjunction with 
> NEAT to try and construct a high-quality adaptive image enlargement
engine.
> 
> Now, being a total newbie to neural nets and NEAT in particular, I
may have 
> some questions.  I'll do my best to figure stuff out on my own, but
if I get 
> stuck, can I ask for help? :)
> 

By all means, and other people here may also be able to help you.  Can
you say a little about what's involved in image enlargement (i.e. how
it works)?  It may give some insight into the way you should approach
it with NEAT.

ken
